messages.title: FAIR IS WORTH FIGHTING FOR
messages.content: Beatrix Campbell is a celebrated writer, broadcaster and playwright. She says "I joined the Green Party because they are the only party that links human wellbeing with the welfare of the planet."

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Vote for a 'Green New Deal' which means thousands of new jobs in greener industries.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Properly funded NHS and public services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Vote for a properly funded NHS and public services – say no privatisation.
Vote for a 'decent' Living Wage' – at least £7.60 an hour for Londoners.
Vote for free insulation for all who need it.

issues.economy: "The economic crisis is a challenge so vote Green for a fairer, healthier, greener Britain"

housing.content: We think it's unfair that so many people are unemployed when there's vital work that needs doing. Bringing Britain's housing up to 'green' standards would create much-needed jobs for builders, plumbers, electricians and engineers.

endorsements.endorsement: Green Party leader and MEP Caroline Lucas receives the prestigious Parliament magazine award as MEP of the Year 2008 for her work on trade.

images.caption: A diverse group of people holding signs for a 'Living Wage'
Workers in industrial and healthcare settings
Beatrix Campbell with another person, in conversation

leaflet.additionalNotes: Printed on 100% recycled paper using sustainable technologies that do not harm the environment.
